alert.note: Alert for Armstrong (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 3:26AM CDT until further notice by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River at Wayside 13NE affecting Armstrong County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River at Wayside 13NE. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Ranch and farm land within the flood plain begins to flood. Cattle in the flood plain are threatened * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM CDT Thursday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 12.0 feet by 7:00 AM Thursday morning and should continue falling to 6.5 feet by 4:00 PM Thursday. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 05/09/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 330 PM CDT.
